sen.j: 朱雀帝/朱雀院（すざくてい・すざくのみかど/すざくいん）は、『源氏物語』に登場する二番目の天皇（在位「葵 (源氏物語)」～「澪標」）。
sen.e: Emperor Suzaku (Suzaku no Mikado), or Suzakuin, is the second emperor in "The Tale of Genji" (the period of his reign, the chapter of 'Aoi' (Hollyhock) to 'Miotsukushi' (Channel Buoys)).
Emperor Suzaku (Suzaku no Mikado), or Suzakuin, is the second emperor in "The Tale of Genji" (the period of his reign, the chapter of 'Aoi' (Hollyhock) to 'Miotsukushi' (Channel Buoys)).
Emperor Suzaku (Suzaku no Mikado), or Suzakuin, is the second emperor in "The Tale of Genji" (the period of his reign, the chapter of 'Aoi' (Hollyhock) to 'Miotsukushi' (Channel Buoys)).

sen.j: 架空の人物。
sen.e: A fictitious character.
A fictitious character.
A fictitious character.

sen.j: 「桐壺」から「夕霧 (源氏物語)」まで登場。
sen.e: He appears from the chapter of 'Kiritsubo' (The Paulownia Court) to 'Yugiri' (Evening Mist).
He appears from the chapter of 'Kiritsubo' (The Paulownia Court) to 'Yugiri' (Evening Mist).
He appears from the chapter of 'Kiritsubo' (The Paulownia Court) to 'Yugiri' (Evening Mist).

sen.j: 桐壺帝の第一皇子で東宮、母は弘徽殿女御（大后）。
sen.e: He was Togu, the first prince, of Emperor Kiritsubo, and his mother was Kokiden no nyogo (Empress Kokiden).
He was Togu, the first prince, of Emperor Kiritsubo, and his mother was Kokiden no nyogo (Empress Kokiden).
He was Togu, the first prince, of the Emperor Kiritsubo, and his mother was Kokiden no nyogo (the Empress Kokiden).
sen.cmt: Emperor, Empressの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 光源氏より3歳上の異母兄。
sen.e: He was three years older than Hikaru Genji, and they had different mothers.
He was three years older than Hikaru Genji, and they had different mothers.
He was three years older than Hikaru Genji, and they had different mothers.

sen.j: 桐壺帝から譲位され24歳で即位（「花宴」と「葵 (源氏物語)」の間）。
sen.e: At the age of 24, his father Emperor Kiritsubo abdicated the throne in favor of his son (between the chapters of 'Hana no En (The Festival of the Cherry Blossoms) and 'Aoi').
sen.cmt: （源氏物語）はリンク先の語のため、訳出しませんでした。以下、同様です。
sen.e: At the age of 24, his father Emperor Kiritsubo abdicated the throne in favor of his son (between the chapters of 'Hana no En (The Festival of the Cherry Blossoms) and 'Aoi').
At the age of 24, his father Emperor Kiritsubo abdicated the throne in favor of his son (between the chapters of 'Hana no En' (The Festival of the Cherry Blossoms) and 'Aoi').
sen.cmt: Enの後に'を挿入しました。

sen.j: 始め東宮時代に葵の上を妃にと申し入れたが、左大臣に断られる。
sen.e: When he was still Togu, he proposed marriage to Aoi no ue (Lady Aoi), but Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) refused him.
When he was still Togu, he proposed marriage to Aoi no ue (Lady Aoi), but Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) refused him.
When he was still Togu, he proposed marriage to Aoi no ue (Lady Aoi), but Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) refused him.

sen.j: その後朧月夜 (源氏物語)が入内する予定だったが、これも源氏との密通により中断を余儀なくされ（その後朧月夜は尚侍として出仕）た。
sen.e: After that, Oborozukiyo (the misty moon) was scheduled to enter the Imperial court, but it was canceled due to her illicit intercourse with Genji (later Oborozukiyo served as Naishi no Kami (Principal Handmaid)).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After that, Oborozukiyo (the misty moon) was scheduled to enter the Imperial court, but it was canceled due to her illicit intercourse with Genji (later Oborozukiyo served as Naishi no Kami (Principal Handmaid)).

After that, Oborozukiyo (the misty moon) was scheduled to enter the Imperial court, but it was canceled due to her illicit intercourse with Genji (later Oborozukiyo served as Naishi no Kami (Principal Handmaid)).

sen.j: 結局有力な妃のない朱雀帝の後宮に中宮は立たなかった。
sen.e: After all, Emperor Suzaku did not have an influential wife, and there was no Empress in kokyu (empress's residence).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After all, Emperor Suzaku did not have an influential wife, and there was no Empress in kokyu (empress's residence).
After all, the Emperor Suzaku did not have an influential wife, and there was no Empress in kokyu (empress's residence).
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 柔和な性格の人物で、容姿・教養すべてに優れた異母弟源氏に引け目を感じ、源氏と朧月夜の密通を知っても彼女を許し寵愛した。
sen.e: He had a mild character, and felt small in the presence of Genji, who was superior to him in everything such as figure and education, so Emperor Suzaku did not blame her and loved her even after he knew the illicit intercourse between Genji and Oborozukiyo.

He had a mild character, and felt small in the presence of Genji, who was superior to him in everything such as figure and education, so Emperor Suzaku did not blame her and loved her even after he knew the illicit intercourse between Genji and Oborozukiyo.

He had a mild character, and felt small in the presence of Genji, who was superior to him in everything such as figure and education, so the Emperor Suzaku did not blame Oborozukiyo and loved her even after he knew the illicit intercourse between Genji and she.
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。 Oborozukiyo の位置を前に移動し、元の場所はsheに変更しました。

sen.j: しかし母である弘徽殿大后その他の源氏追放を止められなかった。
sen.e: However, he could not stop her mother, the Empress Kokiden, and others from banishing Genji.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, he could not stop her mother, the Empress Kokiden, and others from banishing Genji.
However, he could not stop her mother, the Empress Kokiden, and others from banishing Genji.

sen.j: 源氏が須磨に蟄居した後、夢枕に立った桐壺院から叱責を受け、その心労から眼病となる。
sen.e: After Genji confined himself to his residence at Suma, Emperor suzaku received a reprimand from Kiritsuboin, who appeared in his dream, and suffered from eye trouble due to the anxiety.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After Genji confined himself to his residence at Suma, Emperor Suzaku received a reprimand from Kiritsuboin, who appeared in his dream, and suffered from eye trouble due to the anxiety.
After Genji confined himself to his residence at Suma, the Emperor Suzaku received a reprimand from Kiritsuboin, who appeared in his dream, and suffered from eye trouble due to the anxiety.
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 外祖父太政大臣（桐壺帝の右大臣）の死去も重なり、最後は母后の反対を押し切り源氏を召還、異母弟冷泉帝（実は源氏の子）に32歳で譲位。
sen.e: His maternal grandfather, Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state) (Emperor Kiritsubo's Udaijin (Minister of the Right)) passed away, which also led him to call Genji back at last, overcoming the opposition of his mother, and at the age of 32, he abdicated the throne in favor of Emperor Reizei, his younger brother by a different mother (in fact, he was Genji's son).

His maternal grandfather, Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state) (Emperor Kiritsubo's Udaijin (Minister of the Right)) passed away, which also led him to call Genji back at last, overcoming the opposition of his mother, and at the age of 32, he abdicated the throne in favor of Emperor Reizei, his younger brother by a different mother (in fact, he was Genji's son).

His maternal grandfather, Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state) (the Emperor Kiritsubo's Udaijin (Minister of the Right)) passed away, which also led him to call Genji back at last, overcoming the opposition of his mother, and at the age of 32, he abdicated the throne in favor of the Emperor Reizei, his younger brother by a different mother (in fact, he was Genji's son).
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 退位後は朱雀院に住まい（これにより通称を「朱雀帝」「朱雀院」と称する）、朧月夜との平穏な生活を過ごす一方、六条御息所の娘の秋好中宮へも思いをかけたが、斎宮の養父となった源氏の意向で叶わなかった。
sen.e: After his retirement, he lived in Suzakuin (this is why he came to be known by the name of 'Suzakutei' or 'Suzakuin'), and he lived with Oborozukiyo happily, but at the same time he loved Empress Akikonomu, a daughter of Rokujo no Miyasudokoro, though his love was hopeless due to the intention of Genji, who became an adaptive father of Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine).

After his retirement, he lived in Suzakuin (this is why he came to be known by the name of 'Suzakutei' or 'Suzakuin'), and he lived with Oborozukiyo happily, but at the same time he loved Empress Akikonomu, a daughter of Rokujo no Miyasudokoro, though his love was hopeless due to the intention of Genji, who became an adoptive father of Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine).

After his retirement, he lived in Suzakuin (this is why he came to be known by the name of 'Suzakutei' or 'Suzakuin'), and he lived with Oborozukiyo happily, but at the same time he loved the Empress Akikonomu, a daughter of Rokujo no Miyasudokoro, though his love was hopeless due to the intention of Genji, who became an adoptive father of Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine).
sen.cmt: Empressの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 42、43歳頃、母后の崩御、自身の病のため出家を急いだ。
sen.e: At the age of around 42 or 43, her mother passed away, and he became a priest quickly due to his mother's death and his own sickness.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At the age of 42 or 43, his mother passed away, and he became a priest quickly due to his mother's death and his own sickness.
At the age of 42 or 43, his mother passed away, and he became a priest quickly due to his mother's death and his own sickness.

sen.j: そして後見人のいない愛娘女三宮を源氏に降嫁させる。
sen.e: Then he made his beloved daughter, Onna Sannomiya, who did not have a supporter, leave the Imperial family and marry to Genji.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then he made his beloved daughter, Onna Sannomiya, who did not have a supporter, leave the Imperial family and marry Genji.
Then he made his beloved daughter, Onna Sannomiya, who did not have a supporter, leave the Imperial family and marry Genji.

sen.j: しかしこの縁組みは失敗、女三宮と柏木 (源氏物語)の過ちを知らない朱雀院は、冷淡な源氏に恨み言を言いつつ女三宮を出家させた（「若菜 (源氏物語)」「柏木」）。
sen.e: However, this marriage failed, and Suzakuin, who did not know the sexual intercourse between Onna Sannomiya and Kashiwagi, complained to Genji coldly, making Onna Sannomiya become a nun. ('Wakana' (Spring Shoots) and 'Kashiwagi' (The Oak Tree))

However, this marriage failed, and Suzakuin, who did not know of the sexual intercourse between Onna Sannomiya and Kashiwagi, complained to Genji coldly, making Onna Sannomiya become a nun. ('Wakana' (Spring Shoots) and 'Kashiwagi' (The Oak Tree))

However, this marriage failed, and Suzakuin, who did not know of the sexual intercourse between Onna Sannomiya and Kashiwagi, made Onna Sannomiya become a nun complaining to glacial Genji. ('Wakana' (Spring Shoots) and 'Kashiwagi' (The Oak Tree))
sen.cmt: 一部、翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: また女二宮（落葉の宮）も夫柏木と母御息所に先立たれて同じく出家を願ったが、この時は外聞も憚って許さなかった。
sen.e: Onna Ninomiya (Ochiba no Miya) also hoped to become a nun due to the death of her husband, Kashiwagi, and her mother, but he did not allow her, worrying about appearances what people would think.
Onna Ninomiya (Ochiba no Miya) also hoped to become a nun due to the death of her husband, Kashiwagi, and her mother, but he did not allow her, worrying about appearances and what people would think.
Onna Ninomiya (Ochiba no Miya) also hoped to become a nun due to the death of her husband, Kashiwagi, and her mother, but he did not allow her, worrying about appearances and what people would think.

sen.j: その後晩年の消息は不明で、「宿木」で既に故人であることが知られるのみである。
sen.e: The life in his later years was not known, and the only thing that is known in the chapter of 'Yadorigi' (The Ivy), is that he already passed away.
His later years were not known, and the only thing that is known in the chapter of 'Yadorigi' (The Ivy), is that he already passed away.
His later years were not known, and the only thing that is known in the chapter of 'Yadorigi' (The Ivy), is that he already passed away.

sen.j: 承香殿女御…髭黒の妹。
sen.e: Jokyoden no nyogo (The Lady of Jokyoden Palace) --- a younger sister of Higekuro.
Jokyoden no nyogo (The Lady of Jokyoden Palace) --- a younger sister of Higekuro.

sen.e: The mother of Kinjo no Mikado.

sen.j: 今上帝即位前に没、皇太后位を追贈される。
sen.e: She passed away before Kinjo no Mikado succeeded to the throne, and was conferred court rank of Empress Dowager posthumously.
She passed away before Kinjo no Mikado succeeded to the throne, and was conferred court rank of Empress Dowager posthumously.

sen.j: 飛香舎女御（源氏女御）…先帝の皇女、藤壺の異母妹。
sen.e: Higyosha no nyogo (Genji no nyogo) --- a princess of the preceding Emperor, and also a younger sister of Fujitsubo by a different mother.
Higyosha no nyogo (Genji no nyogo) --- a princess of the preceding Emperor, and also a younger sister of Fujitsubo by a different mother.

sen.j: 麗景殿女御…藤大納言（桐壺帝の右大臣の息子）の娘。
sen.e: Reikeiden no nyogo --- a daughter of Todainagon (a son of Emperor Kiritsubo's Udaijin).

sen.j: 「賢木」に名が見える。

sen.e: Koi (a lady in waiting in the court) (Ichijo no Miyasudokoro) --- the mother of Ochiba no Miya.

sen.j: 弘徽殿に住まい、朱雀帝から最も寵愛を受けたが、皇子女はなかった。
sen.e: She lived in Kokiden (one of the Heian Palace buildings), and was loved most by Emperor Suzaku, but she did not have a child.

sen.e: In the second volume of 'Wakana,' she got married to Kashiwagi, leaving the Imperial family, and after the death of Kashiwagi, she was married to Yugiri.
